title: In the Freezer : Abusive Conditions for Women and Children in US ...
htmlTitle: In the Freezer : Abusive Conditions for Women and Children in US ...
snippet: Feb 28, 2018 ... Instead, we identified women and children who had been in US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) detention facilities and, in the ...
htmlSnippet: Feb 28, 2018 ... Instead, we identified women and children who had been in US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) detention facilities and, in the ...

metatags.og:description: This report is based on interviews with 110 women and children. Human Rights Watch found that US Customs and Border Protection (CBP) agents routinely separate adult men and teenage boys from other family members. The practice runs counter to agency policy that families should be kept together whenever possible while in holding cells. After the initial period of detention in the freezing holding cells, sometimes for days, men usually remain separated from the rest of their family upon transfer to longer-term detention facilities.
metatags.twitter:image:alt: Six women and children confined to an immigration holding cell in Douglas, Arizona, appear to share two sleeping mats, September 2015
metatags.og:image:alt: Six women and children confined to an immigration holding cell in Douglas, Arizona, appear to share two sleeping mats, September 2015
metatags.twitter:title: In the Freezer
metatags.og:title: In the Freezer
metatags.twitter:description: This report is based on interviews with 110 women and children. Human Rights Watch found that US Customs and Border Protection (CBP) agents routinely separate adult men and teenage boys from other family members. The practice runs counter to agency policy that families should be kept together whenever possible while in holding cells. After the initial period of detention in the freezing holding cells, sometimes for days, men usually remain separated from the rest of their family upon transfer to longer-term detention facilities.
